intro: Psychotria brachybotrys, commonly known as the "Little Short-stalked Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in areas with high humidity and warm climates. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
